      • set

        public void set(Object data,
       Class<?>... typeSpecs)
        Sets a new and unique representation for our DDF, clearing out any existing ones
        Specified by:
        set in interface IHandleRepresentations
        typeSpecs - a variable-length array of specifications to identify the exact data representation type, e.g., RDD> would be (RDD.class, List.class, Double.class). If not provided, the handler should do its best to infer from the data object.

      • add

        public void add(Object data,
       Class<?>... typeSpecs)
        Adds a new and unique representation for our DDF, keeping any existing ones but replacing the one that matches the given DDFManagerType, dataType tuple.
        Specified by:
        add in interface IHandleRepresentations
        typeSpecs - a variable-length array of specifications to identify the exact data representation type, e.g., RDD> would be (RDD.class, List.class, Double.class). If not provided, the handler should do its best to infer from the data object.
